summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous resolutions 1996 (2011), 2046 (2012), 2057 (2012), 2109 (2013), 2132 (2013), 2155 (2014), 2187 (2014) and 2206 (2015), and its Statements by the President of the Security Council, S/PRST/2014/16, S/PRST/2014/26 and S/PRST/2015/9,

 Reaffirming commitment to sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and national unity of South Sudan, 

Condemning human rights violations, abuses, and international humanitarian law violations, including extrajudicial killings, ethnically targeted violence, rape, and recruitment of children,

 Condemning harassment of civil society, humanitarian personnel, and journalists, 

Expressing concern over 2 million displaced persons and deepening humanitarian crisis,

 Recalling need for full, safe, and unhindered access of relief personnel, equipment, and supplies,

 Commending IGAD initiative for its work in establishing a forum for political and security dialogue,

 Strongly condemning repeated violations of Cessation of Hostilities Agreement,

 Taking note of 6 March 2015 message from Ethiopiaâ€™s Prime Minister and Chairman of IGAD,

 Looking forward to renewed efforts by IGAD and friends of South Sudan to implement a common plan to end the crisis,

 Urges all parties to engage meaningfully in the peace process.
Here is a concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council expresses appreciation for UNMISS peacekeepers' efforts to protect civilians, including foreign nationals, and stabilize the security situation in South Sudan. The Council notes with concern reports on human rights abuses, including war crimes and crimes against humanity, committed by government and opposition forces.
